item.title: Leaking File Descriptors in Go
item.description: Golang, File Descriptors and Finalizers If you Open() a file in Golang and it goes out of scope, then it’ll be closed the next time the garbage collector runs as there’s a cleanup finalizer set when Open() is called. You can see this in action in the following program: package main import ( "fmt" "os" "runtime" ) func allocate() int { //use this file as our test subject _, sourceFile, _, ok := runtime.
